pull.title: fuzz: Temporarily disable failing assert in banman fuzz test
pull.body: Otherwise the remainder of the fuzz test can't be fuzzed without running into crashes

fuzz: Temporarily disable failing assert in banman fuzz test

events.message: fuzz: Temporarily disable failing assert in banman fuzz test

events.body: concept ack, but only if temporary 🧑‍⚖️
Just for reference, one example crash on OSS-Fuzz: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=35561 . Other fuzzing servers are/should be running into this as well.

This _temporary_ change produces a _temporary_ clang warning:
```
test/fuzz/banman.cpp:35:13: warning: unused function 'operator==' [-Wunused-function]
static bool operator==(const CBanEntry& lhs, const CBanEntry& rhs)
            ^
1 warning generated.
```

> This _temporary_ change produces a _temporary_ clang warning:

Warning fixed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22557.
